Entries.default: "See something you like?"
"Couldn't stay away, hm? Well, I can't say I blame you."
"Did you enjoy the show? There's more to see if you're interested."
"How much for your time?"

"Ah, the money-minded type! I've always found fiscal responsibility very... attractive. My time will cost you one hundred and fifty copper, friend." He gifts you with a coy little smile and a raised eyebrow.
"I'm interested."
"Follow me, then." He gives you a quick smile and takes your hand, leading you away.
"Tell me about yourself."
"I suppose." He looks at you with a newly critical eye.
[Leave] "Never mind."

"Hm? No, I still enjoy tile puzzles and deflecting personal questions.

"...Anyway, what are you doing here?" He looks away as though he's trying to ignore Ymir's eager gaze.
"I could ask the same of you!" He laughs lightly, a hand over his mouth.
"It was lovely seeing you!" He catches himself, looking panicked.

"It's good to see you again, Aloth. Anyway, I should get back to it. Be well."

He smiles warmly at Aloth, blush coloring the tips of his ears.
"What kind of 'incident'?"
"How'd you become a courtesan?"
"Let me ask you about something else."

"Same as any of the courtesans here, I imagine."

He brushes his hair back from his face with a sigh. His long-suffering smile says he's answered this question many times before.
"There has to be more to your story than that."
"Like any other job, then."
"There is more to every story." He cants his head to the side, inspecting you with narrowed eyes.

"A handful of my fellow students got up to a bit of mischief that ended with several people dead."

His gaze lingers on the floor, the cushions, the tables, anywhere but your face. After a moment, he shrugs, offering no further explanation.
"Work is work, no matter where you do it." He winks.
"The Empire was my home as well."
"Aha! Then you know how terribly boring it is. Why else would we both be here, eh?"
"What does 'training' entail?"
"I would be happy to show you - for a price."

"Aloth! This is the last place I expected to see you! Have your interests changed so much since our time at Bragganhyl?"

A grin lights up Ymir's face. He fidgets with his hair self-consciously, smoothing it down where it's been mussed.
"This... this is amazing."
"Introduce me to your handsome friend, Aloth."
[Say nothing.]
"This is Ymir, an old friend from my academy days."

"I make my own hours, meet fascinating people, and the coin's nothing to sneer at. Better than stuffy old books and unflattering robes."

He casts a critical eye over Aloth's outfit. He opens his mouth to speak, but decides better of it.
"A pleasure to meet you."

"I was raised in the Aedyr Empire. When I was young, I studied to be an arcane knight.

"After an... incident at my school, I left the continent and wandered until I found myself in Neketaka. As you can see, I stayed."
"'Til later, then."
"I showed an aptitude, I trained with a master, and when I was ready, I began accepting clients of my own."
"But the rest of it of it belongs to me, and I don't care to share it."
"But I am luckier than many - I am free to do what I like, and I like my work."
"I wouldn't mind seeing you again... so long as you come with coin."
"I hope you're not shy."

The dancer turns to greet you, a coy smile tugging at his lips.

He's short for an elf, but no less graceful for his lacking height. His long face and dark eyes lend him a solemn air, but any hint of gloom is chased away by the wash of color in his cheeks.
"Start slowly, please." TekÄ“hu pinches his lower lip and smiles.
"You have my undivided attention." Maia folds her arms and observes, smiling lopsidedly.
"I feel like I should have a problem with this. But mostly I just kind of want to see where this goes." She licks her lips and gives you a little shrug.
"I can see where I may have confused the poor fellow in our academy days."

"Perhaps 'lovely' is too strong a word. I meant... pleasant. Perfectly agreeable."

He looks at you, chagrined.
"'Twas a right fierce labor gettin' the lad to finger any flesh that weren't covering his spellybooks." Iselmyr growls.
